info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 10:01AM PST until February 24 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches, with up to 18 inches at higher elevations. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 1500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County, including the communities of Happy Camp, Scott Bar, and Highway 96 west of Klamath River. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The best chance for road snow accumulations below 2000 feet will be in the presence of heavier showers during the daylight hours today and Thursday. Snow accumulations are likely tonight. Snowfall rates Thursday night could approach an inch per hour. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
